text: My interests revolve around designing, maintaining and perfecting the user interaction side of applications and websites. I usually work with a HTML/CSS/JavaScript stack that involves common tools such as:

toolgroups.name: HTML5
toolgroups.description: HTML5 is the latest evolution of the standard that defines HTML.

toolgroups.name: CSS3
toolgroups.description: CSS3 is the latest evolution of the Cascading Style Sheets language and aims at extending CSS2.1.

toolgroups.name: JavaScript
toolgroups.description: JavaScript (JS) is a lightweight, interpreted, programming language with first-class functions.

toolgroups.name: jQuery
toolgroups.description: jQuery is a fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library. It makes things like HTML document traversal and manipulation, event handling, animation, and Ajax much simpler with an easy-to-use API that works across a multitude of browsers.

toolgroups.name: Sass
toolgroups.description: Sass is the most mature, stable, and powerful professional grade CSS extension language in the world.

toolgroups.name: Less
toolgroups.description: Less (sometimes stylized as LESS) is a dynamic style sheet language that can be compiled into Cascading Style Sheets (CSS).

toolgroups.name: Compass
toolgroups.description: Sass is an extension of CSS3 which adds nested rules, variables, mixins, selector inheritance, and more.

toolgroups.name: Bourbon
toolgroups.description: A simple and lightweight mixin library for Sass.

toolgroups.name: Bootstrap
toolgroups.description: Bootstrap is the most popular HTML, CSS, and JS framework for developing responsive, mobile first projects on the web.

toolgroups.name: Foundation
toolgroups.description: A Framework for any device, medium, and accessibility. Foundation is a family of responsive front-end frameworks that make it easy to design beautiful responsive websites, apps and emails that look amazing on any device.

toolgroups.name: Bulma
toolgroups.description: A modern CSS Framework based on Flexbox.

toolgroups.name: Neat
toolgroups.description: A lightweight semantic grid framework built with Sass.

toolgroups.name: Angular
toolgroups.description: Handlebars provides the power necessary to let you build semantic templates effectively with no frustration.

toolgroups.name: Ember
toolgroups.description: A framework for creating ambitious web applications.

toolgroups.name: React
toolgroups.description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

toolgroups.name: VueJs
toolgroups.description: Vue is a progressive framework for building user interfaces. Unlike other monolithic frameworks, Vue is designed from the ground up to be incrementally adoptable.

toolgroups.name: Node
toolgroups.description: Node.jsÂ® is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine. Node.js uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it lightweight and efficient.

toolgroups.name: Bower
toolgroups.description: A package manager for the web

toolgroups.name: Grunt
toolgroups.description: Automation, performing repetitive tasks like minification, compilation, unit testing and linting.

toolgroups.name: Gulp
toolgroups.description: The streaming build system. Automate and enhance your workflow
